    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_CAP

        public static int DEFAULT_CAP

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomString

        public CustomString()

        Initializes a newly created CustomString object so it represents an empty character sequence

        Precondition:

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • size is initialized to zero
        • capacity is initialized to DEFAULT_CAP
        • values array is initialized to capacity

      • CustomString

        public CustomString(char[] values)

        Initializes a newly created CustomString object so it represents the passed in values

        Precondition:

        • values array must be initialized with values
        • values array is full of characters. That is, all indexes contain a char value
        • if the passed in array is null, uninitialized, or empty, alert the user and exit

        Postcondition:

        • size is initialized to the number of chars passed in
        • capacity is initialized to size + DEFAULT_CAP
        • values array is initialized to contain all the values found in the passed in array
        • don't forget to size your values array to include the capacity discussed above
        Parameters:
        values - an initialized array of character values

        public boolean isEmpty()

        Returns true if the CustomString does not contain characters; otherwise, false.

        Precondition:

        • none

        Postcondition:

        • none
        Returns:

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int index)

        Returns the char value at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to length() - 1. The first char value of the sequence is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as for array indexing.

        Precondition:

        • Values are populated in the CustomString
        • Alert the user and return a null character (the integer 0) if CustomString is empty
        • Alert the user and return a null character (the integer 0) if index is out of bounds (range)

        Postcondition:

        • The character at the specified index is returned
        Parameters:
        index - the location of the char to return
        Returns:
        the char value at the specified index of this string. The first char value is at index 0.

      • getChars

        public void getChars(int srcBegin,
                     int srcEnd,
                     char[] dst,
                     int dstBegin)

        Copies characters from this string into the destination character array. Notice, srcEnd in not inclusive. That is, srcEnd - 1, is the last character copied.

        Precondition:

        • A useful error message is displayed, char[] dst is reinitialized to an empty char array, and processing within the method should be aborted, if any of the following error conditions occur:
          • srcBegin is negative
          • srcBegin is greater than srcEnd
          • srcEnd is greater than the length of this string
          • dstBegin is negative
          • dstBegin+(srcEnd-srcBegin) is greater than dst.length

        Postcondition:

        • char[] dst is returned populated with the appropriate values
        Parameters:
        srcBegin - index of the first character in the string to copy.
        srcEnd - index after the last character in the string to copy.
        dst - the destination array.
        dstBegin - the start offset in the destination array.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object anObject)

        Compares this string to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a CustomString object that represents the same sequence of characters as this object.

        Precondition:

        • false is returned if anObject is null
        • false should be returned if anObject cannot be cast to a CustomString object
        • comparison is a character-by-character case-sensitive check

        Postcondition:

        • The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a CustomString object that represents the same sequence of characters as this object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        anObject - anObject should be a CustomString object
        Returns:
        true if the given object represents a CustomString equivalent to this CustomString, false otherwise.

      • equalsIgnoreCase

        public boolean equalsIgnoreCase(CustomString anotherCString)

        Compares this CustomString to another CustomString, ignoring case considerations Two CustomStrings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two CustomStrings are equal ignoring case.

        Precondition:

        • false is returned if anotherCString is null
        • comparison is a character-by-character case-insensitive check

        Postcondition:

        • The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a CustomString object that represents the same sequence of case-insensitive characters as this object.
        Parameters:
        anotherCString - anotherCString should be a CustomString object to compare against
        Returns:
        true if the argument is not null and it represents an equivalent CustomString ignoring case; false otherwise

      • equalsIgnoreCase

        public boolean equalsIgnoreCase(java.lang.String anotherString)

        Compares this CustomString to another String, ignoring case considerations The strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case.

        Precondition:

        • false is returned if string is null
        • comparison is a character-by-character case-insensitive check

        Postcondition:

        • The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a string object that represents the same sequence of case-insensitive characters as this object.
        Parameters:
        anotherString - anotherString should be a string object to compare against
        Returns:
        true if the argument is not null and it represents an equivalent string ignoring case; false otherwise

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(CustomString anotherCString)

        Compares this CustomString to another CustomString lexicographically.

        Precondition:

        • 1 is returned if anotherCString is null

        Postcondition:

        • 0 is returned if the two CustomStrings are equivalent. For example, 'ABC' == 'ABC'
        • -1 is returned if this CustomString is less than anotherCString. For example, 'ABC' < 'XYZ'
        • -1 is returned if this CustomString is less than anotherCString. For example, 'ABC' < 'abc'
        • -1 is returned if this CustomString is less than anotherCString. For example, 'ABC' < 'ABCD'
        • 1 is returned if this CustomString is greater than anotherCString. For example, the converse of the above examples.
        Parameters:
        anotherCString - anotherCString should be a CustomString object to compare against
        Returns:
        the value 0 if the argument string is equal to this string; -1 if this string is lexicographically less than the string argument; 1 if this string is lexicographically greater than the string argument.

      • toCharArray

        public char[] toCharArray()

        Converts this CustomString to a new character array. Note, the returned array's length() should equal this CustomString's size. That is, all indices in the returned array should hold characters.

        Precondition:

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • An empty array is returned if this CustomString is empty
        • Returns an array of characters. Values should not be returned directly, as it may contain empty indices.
        Returns:
        returns an array of characters

      • append

        public void append(char[] values)

        Appends the values in char[] values to the end of this CustomString

        Precondition:

        • If passed in array is null or empty, an error message is displayed to the user, and this CustomString is unchanged

        Postcondition:

        • The values in the passed in array are added to the end of this CustomString
        • This CustomString's values array is resized if needed to accommodate the new values.
        • If this CustomString's values array requires resizing, the new capacity should be the new size + DEFAULT_CAP.
        Parameters:
        values - a char arrays with values to be appended

      • resize

        public void resize(int newCap)

        Resizes CustomString's built in values array to accommodate holding additional chars

        Precondition:

        • If the new capacity if not larger than the old, alert the user and exit.

        Postcondition:

        • CustomString's values array is increased in capacity the new capacity.
        • CustomString's size, capacity, and current values are preserved and updated as needed during the resize.
        Parameters:
        newCap - the new larger capacity

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(CustomString prefix)

        Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.

        Precondition:

        • Return an error message and return false if prefix is null or longer than this CustomString

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by this CustomString; false otherwise.

      • endsWith

        public boolean endsWith(CustomString suffix)

        Tests if this string ends with the specified suffix.

        Precondition:

        • Return an error message and return false if suffix is null or longer than this CustomString

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix
        Returns:
        true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(char c)

        Returns the index within this CustomString of the first occurrence of the specified character.

        Precondition:

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        c - a character
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the character in the character sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the character does not occur.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(int c)

        Returns the index within this CustomString of the first occurrence of the specified character. Recall, characters can be represented with integers also. For example, 'A' == 65 and 'a' == 97

        Precondition:

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        c - a character
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the character in the character sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the character does not occur.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(CustomString anotherCString)

        Returns the index within this CustomString of the first occurrence of the specified CustomString. For example... this = "hamburger", anotherCString = "burg", returns 3 this = "Mississippi", anotherCString = "iss", returns 1 this = "Mississippi", anotherCString = "ipp", returns 7

        Precondition:

        • Alert the user and return -1 if this CustomString is smaller then anotherCString.

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        anotherCString - the CustomString to search for in this CustomString
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of anotherCString in the character sequence represented by this object, or -1 if the character does not occur.

      • substring

        public CustomString substring(int beginIndex,
                              int endIndex)

        Returns a new CustomString that is a substring of this CustomString. The substring begins with the character at the specified index and extends to the end of this string. For example... "hamburger" -- substring(4, 8) returns "urge" "smiles" -- substring(1, 5) returns "mile"

        Precondition:

        • If beginIndex or endIndex are out of range, alter the user and return null./

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        beginIndex - the beginning index, inclusive.
        endIndex - the ending index, exclusive.
        Returns:
        the specified substring

      • replace

        public CustomString replace(char oldChar,
                            char newChar)

        Returns a new CustomString resulting from replacing all occurrences of oldChar in this string with newChar. Note, this CustomString remains unaltered.

        Precondition:

        • If oldChar does not exist in this CustomString, return this CustomString as is./

        Postcondition:

        • Returns a new string resulting from replacing all occurrences of oldChar in this string with newChar.
        Parameters:
        oldChar - the old character
        newChar - the new character
        Returns:
        returns a new CustomString resulting from replacing all occurrences of oldChar in this string with newChar.

      • replace

        public CustomString replace(CustomString target,
                            CustomString replacement)

        Returns a new CustomString resulting from replacing all occurrences of target in this string with replacement. Note, this CustomString remains unaltered. For example... this = "bug", target = "u", replacement = "i", result = "big" this = "The dog chased the dog", target = "dog", replacement = "cat", result = "The cat chased the cat" this = "The dog chased the dog", target = "dog", replacement = "ox", result = "The ox chased the ox" this = "The dog chased the dog", target = "dog", replacement = "elephant", result = "The elephant chased the elephant" Hint: Work on this one last and utilize many of the methods you have already created.

        Precondition

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • Returns a new CustomString resulting from replacing all occurrences of target in this string with replacement.
        Parameters:
        target - the old string sequence
        replacement - the new string sequence
        Returns:
        returns a new CustomString resulting from replacing all occurrences of target in this string with replacement.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(CustomString anotherCString)

        Returns true if and only if this CustomString contains the sequence of characters found in another CustomString.

        Precondition:

        • Alert the user and return false if this CustomString is smaller then anotherCString.

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Parameters:
        anotherCString - the other CustomString to search for
        Returns:
        returns true if and only if this CustomString contains the sequence of characters found in another CustomString.

      • toUpperCase

        public CustomString toUpperCase()

        Converts all of the characters in this String to upper case. A new CustomString is returned and this CustomString remains unaltered

        Precondition:

        • None

        Postcondition:

        • None
        Returns:
        returns a new CustomString with all character converted to upper case
